cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north-to-northeast inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near Morgan City to the Mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Texas coast (warnings begin east of Cameron, LA)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire northern Gulf Coast from Sabine Pass, TX eastward to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (40–50 mph) possible late Saturday night through Sunday as the center passes east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible around Sabine Pass and Port Arthur under on-shore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 4–6 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and a low-end tornado threat in outer rain-bands
